intro: Cnicus lachenalii, commonly known as the Lachenal's thistle, is a perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is often found in coastal areas. Cnicus lachenalii is considered a rare and endemic species, with limited distribution across southern Europe.
